functions.name: acosh
functions.description: Inverse hyperbolic cosine.
functions.summary: Inverse hyperbolic cosine.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the arg

functions.name: asinh
functions.description: Calculate the inverse hyperbolic sine.
functions.summary: Calculate the inverse hyperbolic sine.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the arg

functions.name: atanh
functions.description: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.
functions.summary: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: must be in range -1 ... +1 (exclusive)

functions.name: avedev
functions.description:
Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean.

The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. Sequence can be of any length from 1 up.

functions.name: cast-as-numeric
functions.description:
Cast the anyAtomicType to a numeric type.

If the value is already of a numeric type then nothing is changed. Otherwise the value is casted to the numeric type that is most appropriate.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Cast the anyAtomicType to a numeric type.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The parameter can be a number, string, boolean value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:VALUE_NOT_NUMERIC if the value cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: ceiling
functions.signature: ($number as double, $significance as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

Significance must have the same sign as number. Number and significance must be of a numeric type or castable to numeric. Significance must not be zero.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value you want to round.

parameters.name: significance
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: cosh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.

If the result it too large, INF is returned.
functions.summary: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: must be smaller than 7.104760e+002

functions.name: deg-to-rad
functions.description:
Convert angle from degrees to radians.

The parameter is first converted to value range of (-360, 360).
functions.summary: Convert angle from degrees to radians.

parameters.name: deg
parameters.description: angle in degrees

functions.name: even
functions.description:
Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer.

Regardless of the sign of number, a value is rounded up when adjusted away from zero.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round.

returns.description: The rounded value casted as numeric type.

functions.name: fact
functions.description:
Returns the factorial of a number.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the factorial of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The non-negative number you want the factorial of.

returns.description: Returns the factorial of a number. The factorial of a number is equal to 1*2*3*...* number.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the number is smaller than zero</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: factdouble
functions.description:
Returns the double factorial of a number.

Computes the double factorial of n as n(n-2)(n-4)...

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the double factorial of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The positive integer value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the number is negative.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: floor
functions.signature: ($number as double, $significance as double) as double
functions.description:
Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

Significance must have the same sign as number. Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value you want to round.

parameters.name: significance
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round.

returns.description: The rounded value as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: fmod
functions.signature: ($x as double, $y as double) as double external
functions.description: Function performing the modulo operation between the two arguments.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y

functions.name: frexp
functions.description:
Returns the argument split as mantissa and exponent.

The recombining formula is (mantissa * 2^exponent).
functions.summary: Returns the argument split as mantissa and exponent.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the double to be split.

returns.description: A sequence of two doubles (mantissa, exponent)

functions.name: gcd
functions.description:
Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers.

The sequence can have one or more positive integers.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of positive integers.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any number is smaller than zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: int
functions.description:
Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.

Positive numbers are rounded toward zero, negative numbers are rounded away from zero.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to be rounded.

functions.name: is-a-number
functions.description:
Checks if the anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Checks if the anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Parameter to be checked.

returns.description: true if the value can be casted to numeric.

functions.name: is_inf
functions.description: Checks if the double value is positive or negative infinite.
functions.summary: Checks if the double value is positive or negative infinite.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the double to be checked

returns.description: boolean true if argument is pos INF or neg INF

functions.name: is_nan
functions.description: Checks if the double value is Not a Number (NaN).
functions.summary: Checks if the double value is Not a Number (NaN).

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the arg

returns.description: boolean true if the double is NaN

functions.name: large
functions.signature: ($numbers as double+, $k as integer) as double
functions.description:
Returns the k-th largest value in a data set.

If n is the number of data points in a range, then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value, and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the k-th largest value in a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: the position of largest value, with value from 1 to count of values

returns.description: The k-th largest value as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is empty or k is not a value between 1 and the size of the sequence</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: lcm
functions.description:
Returns the least common multiple of integers.

LCM for two numbers is computed by multiplying them and dividing with GCD. The function is applied recursively replacing the first two numbers in the sequence with their LCM.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the least common multiple of integers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of one or more positive integers.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any number is smaller than zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: ldexp
functions.signature: ($x as double, $i as integer) as double external
functions.description:
Computes a real number from the mantissa and exponent.

The formula is (x * 2^i).
functions.summary: Computes a real number from the mantissa and exponent.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the mantissa

parameters.name: i
parameters.description: the exponent

functions.name: median
functions.description:
Returns the median of the given numbers.

The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers. Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median, and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the median of the given numbers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

returns.description: for odd count of numbers return the number in the middle of the sorted sequence. For even count of numbers return the average of the two numbers in the middle.

functions.name: mod
functions.signature: ($number as double, $divisor as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor.

The result has the same sign as divisor.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number for which you want to find the remainder.

parameters.name: divisor
parameters.description: The number by which you want to divide number. This cannot be zero.

returns.description: The remainder from division as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if divisor is zero after casting to numeric.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mode
functions.description:
Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_INPUT if there are no duplicate numbers</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: modf
functions.description:
Splits a floating-point value into fractional and integer parts.

Both the fraction and integer keep the original sign of the value.
functions.summary: Splits a floating-point value into fractional and integer parts.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the double to be split.

returns.description: A sequence of two doubles (fraction, integer)

functions.name: mround
functions.signature: ($number as decimal, $multiple as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple.

MROUND rounds up, away from zero, if the remainder of dividing number by multiple is greater than or equal to half the value of multiple. MROUND is computed through math:floor function.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round,

parameters.name: multiple
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round number.

returns.description: The rounded number up to the desired multiple.

functions.name: odd
functions.description:
Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round.

functions.name: percentile
functions.signature: ($numbers as double*, $k_at as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence.

If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1), PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile. The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers, of any length

parameters.name: k_at
parameters.description: the percentile, with value between 0 .. 1 inclusive

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if percentile is not between 0 .. 1</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: percentrank
functions.signature: ($numbers as double*, $x as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set.

If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank.
The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: is the value for which you want to know the rank

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: prob
functions.signature: ($x_range as double+, $prob_range as double+, $range_lower_limit as double) as double
functions.description:
This is the same as math:prob#4, only that upper_limit is not specified.

The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: This is the same as math:prob#4, only that upper_limit is not specified.

parameters.name: x_range
parameters.description: is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.

parameters.name: prob_range
parameters.description: is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.

parameters.name: range_lower_limit
parameters.description: is the value for which you want a probability.

returns.description: The probability of the range_lower_limit value

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any probability is not between 0 and 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: prob
functions.signature: ($x_range as double+, $prob_range as double+, $range_lower_limit as double, $upper_limit as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.

parameters.name: x_range
parameters.description: is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.

parameters.name: prob_range
parameters.description: is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.

parameters.name: range_lower_limit
parameters.description: is the lower bound on the value for which you want a probability.

parameters.name: upper_limit
parameters.description: is the upper bound on the value for which you want a probability.

returns.description: The probability of the entire range

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any probability is not between 0 and 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: product
functions.description:
Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of arguments convertible to numeric types. The sequence can be of any length.

returns.description: The multiplication result as numeric type.

functions.name: quartile
functions.signature: ($numbers as double*, $quart as integer) as double
functions.description:
Returns the quartile of a data set.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the quartile of a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: quart
parameters.description:
one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 with meaning:
0
compute minimum value
1
compute first quartile (25th percentile)
2
compute median value (50th percentile)
3
compute third quartile (75th percentile)
4
compute maximum value

returns.description: the computed quartile, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length or $quart is not one of the values 0,1,3,4</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: quotient
functions.signature: ($numerator as double, $denominator as double) as integer
functions.description:
Returns the integer portion of a division.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the integer portion of a division.

parameters.name: numerator
parameters.description: The divider.

parameters.name: denominator
parameters.description: The divisor. It cannot be zero.

returns.description: The result value as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if denominator casted as numeric type has value zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rad-to-deg
functions.description: Convert angle from radians to degrees.
functions.summary: Convert angle from radians to degrees.

parameters.name: rad
parameters.description: value in radians

functions.name: rank
functions.signature: ($x as double, $numbers as double*) as double
functions.description:
This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The number whose rank you want to find.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

functions.name: rank
functions.signature: ($x as double, $numbers as double*, $order_ascending as boolean) as double
functions.description:
Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.

The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list. (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.) RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The number whose rank you want to find.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

parameters.name: order_ascending
parameters.description:
A boolean having the meaning:
false
then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in descending order.
true
then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in ascending order.

functions.name: roman
functions.description:
Converts an Arabic numeral to roman, as text.

Only the classic format is supported (out of all formats Excel requires). M is the largest digit, it represents 1000. Numbers bigger than 2000 will be represented by a sequence of "M". D = 500, C = 100, L = 50, X = 10, V = 5, I = 1.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Converts an Arabic numeral to roman, as text.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: A positive integer.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the input integer is negative</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: round
functions.signature: ($number as double, $precision as integer) as double
functions.description:
Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.

If precision is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded to the left of the decimal point. The 0.5 is rounded away from zero.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: The rounded number as numeric type.

functions.name: rounddown
functions.signature: ($number as double, $precision as integer) as double
functions.description:
Rounds a number down, toward zero.

If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Rounds a number down, toward zero.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: the truncated number toward zero, as numeric type.

functions.name: roundup
functions.signature: ($number as double, $precision as integer) as double
functions.description:
Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero).

If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero).

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: The truncated number away from zero, as numeric type.

functions.name: sign
functions.description:
Determines the sign of a number.

Returns 1 if the number is positive, zero (0) if the number is 0, and -1 if the number is negative.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Determines the sign of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument

functions.name: sinh
functions.description: Calculate the hyperbolic sine.
functions.summary: Calculate the hyperbolic sine.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the arg

functions.name: slope
functions.signature: ($known_y as double+, $known_x as double+) as double
functions.description:
Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's.

The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the formula:

sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) / sum((x - average_x)^2)

where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's.

parameters.name: known_y
parameters.description: the sequence of y numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: known_x
parameters.description: the sequence of x numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: The slope value, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_INPUT if there are different numbers of x's and y's or if the sequence is empty</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:DIVIDE_BY_0 if all x's are equal</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: small
functions.signature: ($numbers as double*, $k as integer) as double
functions.description:
This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set.

Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set. If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value, and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest value. Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: A sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: The position (from the smallest) in the sequence of data to return. Must have value between 1 and size of sequence.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if the sequence is zero length or $k is not a value between 1 and the size of sequence.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sort-numbers
functions.description:
Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric.

It first casts all arguments to numeric and then sorts ascending.

Helper function.
Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of arguments castable to numeric.

returns.description: The sorted sequence as numeric types.

functions.name: standardize
functions.signature: ($x as double, $mean as double, $standard_dev as double) as double
functions.description:
Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.

The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: is the value you want to normalize

parameters.name: mean
parameters.description: is the arithmetic mean of the distribution.

parameters.name: standard_dev
parameters.description: is the standard deviation of the distribution.

returns.description: The normalized x, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if standard_dev is a value smaller than zero or equal</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: stdev
functions.description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VAR(numbers) )

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

functions.name: stdeva
functions.description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VARA(numbers) )

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

functions.name: stdevp
functions.description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARP(numbers) )

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

functions.name: stdevpa
functions.description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARPA(numbers) )

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

functions.name: subtotal
functions.signature: ($function_num as integer, $numbers as double*) as double
functions.description:
Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers.

The function applied is given by $function_num.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers.

parameters.name: function_num
parameters.description:
defines the function to be applied on sequence values. The possible values are:
1 or 101
AVERAGE
2 or 102
COUNT
3 or 103
COUNTA
4 or 104
MAX
5 or 105
MIN
6 or 106
PRODUCT
7 or 107
STDEV
8 or 108
STDEVP
9 or 109
SUM
10 or 110
VAR
11 or 111
VARP
In this implementation there is no difference between x and 10x.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length.

returns.description: The function result, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">* depends on the function called</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">math:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $function_num is not a value between 1 .. 11 or 101 .. 111</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sumproduct
functions.signature: ($array1 as double*, $array2 as double*) as double
functions.description:
Multiplies the elements on the same position in each sequence and sums up the results.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Multiplies the elements on the same position in each sequence and sums up the results.

parameters.name: array1
parameters.description: the sequences of numbers

parameters.name: array2
parameters.description: the sequences of numbers

functions.name: sumsq
functions.description:
Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments.

It uses the sumproduct function.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of one or more numbers

returns.description: the sum of squared values, as numeric type

functions.name: tanh
functions.description: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.
functions.summary: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the arg

functions.name: trunc
functions.description:
Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument .

functions.name: trunc
functions.signature: ($number as double, $precision as integer) as double
functions.description:
Truncates a number down to precision.

This behaves exactly like rounddown.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Truncates a number down to precision.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument castable to numeric type.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep .

functions.name: var
functions.description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Estimates variance based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

functions.name: vara
functions.description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Estimates variance based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

functions.name: varp
functions.description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Calculates variance based on the entire population.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

functions.name: varpa
functions.description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.

The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

Borrowed from excel module.
functions.summary: Calculates variance based on the entire population.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
